column20: Proper Form
column24: Description

column20: Set tee at chest height. Keep hands above the ball; avoid "dipping."
column24: Practice hitting the top-zone pitch to prevent pop-ups.

column20: Swing at 100% speed but freeze the bat perfectly at contact.
column24: Swing at full speed but halt all movement at the point of contact.

column20: Isolate lead hand (pull) and back hand (push) with a short bat.
column24: Isolate individual arm movements to find "pull" and "push" paths.

column20: Set at bottom of zone. Stay in your legs and maintain spine angle.
column24: Practice staying low on pitches at the bottom of the strike zone.

column20: Hold a back-leg balance for 2 seconds to feel the load.
column24: Static balance drill to ensure the weight is properly "loaded."

column20: Step through with the back foot to build linear momentum.
column24: Linear movement drill to help players who "leak" power.

column20: Swing in front of a mirror to check head movement and path.
column24: Visual feedback drill to check posture and bat path.

column20: Very light tool used to feel hip/hand sequencing.
column24: Using a weightless tool to emphasize kinetic sequencing.

column20: No ball. Focus on the "whoosh" sound at the contact point.
column24: Dry swings used to map out the swing path without a ball.

column20: Partner tosses from 45°. Keep head still and hands short to the ball.
column24: Close-range side toss to work on hand-eye coordination.

column20: Tossed from 15ft behind a screen. Timing the load is key.
column24: Underhand toss from behind a screen to simulate live pitching.

column20: Two tees. Practice "out front" (inside) vs "deep" (outside).
column24: Two-tee setup to practice directional hitting.

column20: Choke up, widen stance, and shorten the swing path.
column24: Shortened swing mechanics for defensive hitting.

column20: 5-10 balls in quick succession to eliminate extra movement.
column24: High-tempo toss to build muscle memory and eliminate "fluff."

column20: Call out the ball color before hitting to increase focus.
column24: Visual tracking drill using numbered or colored balls.

column20: Focus on a high-to-low hand path to stay on top of the rise.
column24: Specific drill to combat the rise ball's upward trajectory.

column20: Wait for the ball to "travel" deeper into the zone.
column24: Training the eyes to recognize spin and wait for movement.

column20: Lift front knee high, hold, then drive forward explosively.
column24: Exaggerated leg kick to find a powerful drive point.

column20: Bottom hand on top. Teaches lead hand how to lead.
column24: Cross-handed grip to force the lead arm to do the work.

column20: Close eyes at stride, open at contact. Improves spatial sense.
column24: Blindfold/eyes closed until stride to feel the body's center.

column20: 2-inch gap between hands. Prevents the bat from dragging.
column24: Hands spaced apart to feel the bat rotate around the handle.

column20: Hold bat behind back with elbows and rotate through the ball.
column24: Holding bat across the low back to isolate the hips.

column20: Focus on speed, not just "muscle." Don't let weight drag hands.
column24: Overload training to build forearm and core strength.

column20: Toss from behind the hitter. Forces staying "inside" the ball.
column24: Tossed from behind the hitter's shoulder.

column20: Toss two balls; caller picks "top" or "bottom" mid-flight.
column24: Two balls tossed; hitter reacts to a verbal cue.

column20: Lead with the knob to keep hands inside and avoid arm-barring.
column24: Direct hand path drill to stop "casting" or long swings.

column20: Sit on a bucket. Swing using only upper body rotation.
column24: Seated swing to remove the legs and isolate the core.

column20: Teaches you to find the "sweet spot" via vibration feedback.
column24: Feedback drill; wood provides immediate vibration on misses.

column20: Put tee on the outside corner. Stay "closed" with shoulders.
column24: Placing the ball far outside to force a "closed" shoulder.

column20: Set 5mph above game speed to train reaction time.
column24: High-velocity training for reaction time.

column20: Stand bat-length from fence. Swing without hitting the fence.
column24: Swing path check by standing close to a fence.

column20: Use plyo balls. Requires "firm" contact to avoid bat recoil.
column24: Using heavy plyo balls to ensure through-contact.

column20: Large crow-hop into the swing for maximum lower-half power.
column24: Crow-hop movement to find maximum lower-half load.

column20: Eyes at barrel level. Keep fingers behind the barrel.
column24: Fundamental bunting mechanics.

column20: Hit the bottom-center of the ball to create 15–25° backspin.
column24: Focus on ball exit trajectory.

column20: Throw a med ball against a wall using hitting rotation.
column24: Throwing medicine balls to build rotational torque.

column20: Tracking the ball from release to the hitting zone.
column24: Most realistic training; tracking from the mound.

column20: Focus on a steeper entry angle to catch the falling ball.
column24: Targeting the "drop" pitch path.

column20: Sequence: 3 to opposite field, 3 up middle, 3 to pull side.
column24: Directional sequencing (Opposite, Middle, Pull).

column20: Tracking movement without the fatigue of a heavy ball.
column24: High-repetition tracking without fatigue.
